html.p: What is the difference between declarative and imperative knowledge?

div.p: Declarative knowledge is statements of fact; imperative knowledge is "how to" knowledge.

html.p: What is the advantage of a stored-program computer?

div.p: It's far more versatile than a fixed-program computer, since it interprets a program given to it and carries out those instructions, as opposed to being built to do one thing.

html.p: What are the syntax, static semantics, and semantics of a language?

div.p: Syntax determines whether a string is legal, static semantics determine whether the string has meaning, and semantics assigns a meaning to a legal sentence (assuming no static semantic errors).

html.p: What sorts of errors can occur in a program?

div.p: It can crash, run forever, or give a wrong answer.
